Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that organs were forcefully removed from the dead body without providing substantial evidence or proof.

Falters at times: The claim may lack consistency or clarity in presenting the details and evidence related to the missing organs.
Understate: The claim may understate the seriousness or significance of the alleged missing organs, as it does not provide comprehensive information or evidence to support the claim.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts established facts or official reports, as there is no official confirmation or evidence of organs being missing from the dead body in Manori and Gorai in Mumbai.
